thread.text:
Ok guys it now is day 3 with the zenfone 2 and for some reason the data is not working. Ive changed the APN settings several times and no avail. Somehow for a strange reason when making a call data turns on to 3g and the H+ but no LTE. I tried surfing the web and viola but as soon as I hang up data is gone. These are my settings as of now. If any of you have this phone on metro and have data working please help. Thanks in advance. 
Name
Metro PCS (don't think it matters tho)
APN - fast.t-mobile.com
MMSC - http://mms.msg.eng.t-mobile.com/mms/wapenc
APN type - default,mms,supl
I'm not with Metro but see if changing the MMSC to the one in this thread helps. Metro Pcs / TMobile 4G or LTE Not Working , … | AT&T HTC One (M7) | XDA Forums

Tried those APN settings jpr and it would only get me as far as 3G and H+ but the phone had to be changed to 2G/3G in the settings. After awhile they were gone and I switched the settings to 2G/3G/4G and it kinda worked. After some digging here in the forums this is what worked for me. Thanks to ambassador Rukbat for posting this. 
Try this as your APN settings:
Name: MetroPCS (this is just so you know which one it is - you can name it anything)
APN: fast.metropcs.com
Proxy:
Port:
Username:
Password:
Server:
MMSC: http://mms.metropcs.mmsmvno.com/mms/wapenc
MMS Proxy:
MMS Port:
MCC:310
MNC:260
Authentication tupe:
APN Type: default,mms,supl
APPN protocol:IPv4/IPv6
APN roaming protocol:IPv4
I'm having the same problem. It was working for an hour after I was at MetroPCS having them install the SIM, but my data just stopped working.

Thank you josearmz. I copied your settings 100% and as soon as I switched to the new APN, 4G enabled. 
It's been working just fine for a good 15 min now. I'll update if anything else comes up
Thanks! Worked like a charm, after 3 days of in and out (but mostly out) data. I'll let you know if anything changes.
Thank you so much! It worked perfectly!

title: My Phone is connected to Wi-Fi but doesn't have internet access

thread.text:
My WiFi issue started after I upgraded my internet speed in our home. Our Internet Service Provider change the router to a new one and after that the issue occur. The weird thing is I'm the only one suffering with the problem and all the other users are just fine. 
Now thinking that my phone have the issue but I conclude that it is not. My phone can still use the WiFi in my work and other places.
Accurately this is what happening: 
I connect to Wifi = Success
I use the internet = good but after a few minutes it the speed degrades until goes to nothing 
That cycle repeats/something there's no internet at all everytime i reboot both my phone and router, reconect to wifi, or do some solutions I already searched in the internet such as; changing DNS , IP address and other settings I can do with the router.
Please Help What can I do my last resort is buying a new phone 
Phone: Asus Zenfone 2 
Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow
Router: Technicolor
Welcome to Android Central! Check the router's settings to see if there is a QoS setting (Quality of Service). If so, turn that off.

Welcome to Android Central! I can't find a way to turn it off for the Gmail app only on my ZenFone 2. One workaround is to use QuickShortcutMaker to create a new Gmail shortcut that won't use ZenUI's unread count badge. The icon will still look the same as the actual Gmail icon.

Hi you can go to settings => App's => Gmail => untick remove notification.

I've seen similar issues posted on other sites, but no real good answer, so I thought I'd post it here for comments and suggestions.
After automatically updating to the last Android 5.1 OTA, my screen started to do this strange thing. it would display either ghost artifacts or vertical colour lines that were related to what should have been displayed. For example on startup, the usual white ASUS was a set of vertical white lines, if the display was multi-coloured, the vertical lines would be aligned with the colours. The lines started from about half way up the screen and went down to the bottom. The top half was not affected, so I could see the top half of whatever was displayed, but the bottom half was all vertical lines. This was infrequent at first, but then became more frequent until the phone became virtually unusable.
I went through a couple of steps to try to fix it:
1. left it turned off for a few days, then loaded Android 6 from the ASUS website. This worked for the first restart but then the same display issue came back.
2. spoke to ASUS support, on their recommendation did a factory reset, again the first one worked for a bit, then I tried it again but now nothing worked.
3. spoke with support again, got an RMA. They made it clear that if the issue is impact damage I'm going to foot the bill. I've requested an "advanced replacement" so that I'm not out of a phone for another 2 weeks.
When I was trying to get it to work, I noticed a pattern to the issue. If the display colour, or predominant colour was "dark" in the middle third of the screen, the bottom would go wonky as I've described. If the middle third of the display was light or white, the entire screen was okay. So for example, if I had a white website, and scrolled down (or up) to an area that had darker colours, as soon as the dark colour crossed the boundary (about 1/2 inch from the vertical center of the screen, above or below center) the bottom half turned into vertical lines or left a ghost image, or pieces of both.
I have not damaged the phone, dropped or bent it at all. The one thing that I noticed after the update for 5.1 was that it felt hotter than usual.
That's all I have, hopefully someone can help figure out what this is. I'm not expecting to hear much from ASUS themselves, just whether I pay or they cover it. If anyone else is getting this weirdness, join in the conversation. 
Thanks in advance.
Welcome to Android Central! Have you already tried Safe Mode and wiping the cache partition?How to turn on safe mode on Asus Zenfone 2 ZE551MLhttps://www.asus.com/zentalk/thread-9229-1-1.html

Thanks B.Diddy, 
I think I went further than safe mode when I did a factory reset, there's nothing on it now except the bare minimum apps (I didn't log in to either Google or Asus so none of my old data/config/apps were loaded). Having said that, I did go into safe mode and tried to clean out any non-essential apps, and disabled as much as I thought was safe to do. I've also now wiped the cache partition and restarted it.
FYI, prior to starting the steps you suggested, it seems that by leaving it off for a couple of days, the screen effects are almost gone. There is a flicker mid-screen at the initial power up, just above the bright "ASUS", but after running it for a couple of hours there's no noticeable affect. It's still there after wiping the cache. I'm going to leave it on for a day or so & see if there's any degradation.

title: Zenfone 2 laser will not charge (and its not the battery)

thread.text:
Hey,
So I've rma'd this stupid phone 3 times already. And it just came out of warranty.
Yesterday morning my phone restarted on its own, and then the battery started draining... fast.
Even when plugged in, and it said it was charging, it continued to drain. After 20 minutes it went from 100% to 60%. I shut off the phone. When I turned it back on 2 hours later, it was at 18%. Then it drained completely after another 20 minutes.
Then, when attempting to charge it, it would not charge at all.
I thought it might be the battery, so I did some tests. The rest of my family has zenfones as well, so I took the battery out of one of their phones, and put my dead battery into their phone. It started to charge.
Then I put their full battery into my phone, and the phone turned on, but once again - drained FAST.
Both batteries work perfectly in the working zenfone 2 laser. But in mine, the charging won't work at all, and drains even when plugged in.
Any ideas what's going on? Do I just need to get a new phone? (not another Asus, God forbid) Has anyone else experienced this?
Thanks!!

It sounds as if something is shorted on your motherboard. (RMAing a phone doesn't always result in your getting another phone - I've had phones and computers returned with the equivalent of "nothing wrong found".)

2) If I don't select the network, every time it connects to a foreign network, it asks if I want data connection enabled,
even though I have selected the option "data roaming off" (of course sometimes I select by mistake "roaming on", and get charged for that)
--> "off" should mean "off", not "ask every time"
3) If I am abroad for some time and I have told him "no data for this trip", when I come back to my country
and I connect to my homecountry network, data connection does not work, so I have to reboot 
--> no data for this trip should last as long as the trip last, not forever.
Can anybody help me?
Thx
PB

My only suggestion would be to go into settings/more/cellular networks/network operators then press choose a network operator then search networks and find yours. I believe the phone could be set to choose automatically and then it might be connecting to the one you don't want.
I had to do this on a trip to get my network to work. You have to remember to go in and find the correct network whenever you change countries if you don't use auto

title: Forced to use the ZenUI PC Suite, recommendations?

thread.text:
Previously, when connecting the Zenfone 2 to my laptop, it was possible to go to the DCIM folder to copy photos. Now, however, when connecting via usb, the Zenfone does not appear as a drive with the option to go into that folder. It shows up only as CD Drive (F Asus ZenUI PC Suite, with option to install it. Whether installed or not, I'm still not able to go into the this folder or any other, to transfer the pics. 
Recommendations? Thank you.
While connected: go to Settings > Storage > Tap on USB storage icon on top > uncheck and then check MTP.
Upon unchecking MTP, it quickly and automatically rechecks itself, and then the described problem persists. What to try next? Thank you.

Go to your Laptop check if the drivers are properly installed on the lower right hand side of your screen when you connect your USB.
When you connect your USB your device should pop up something on the notification panel tap on the same, Connected USB => MTP => Check.
You can also follow Zentalk for community support.

When connecting the usb cable, in the lower right hand corner this notification appears: "CD Drive (F Asus ZenUI PC Suite | Tap to choose what happens with this disc". Hi guys,

TIA
Welcome to Android Central! It means there are new features or settings since it was recently updated. ASUS does this with their apps and their system settings menu.

Anyone know how to disable it?? Every time I'm biking and receive a text, the phone wakes and all hell breaks loose in my pocket. I don't want any notification waking the phone and I'm going crazy trying to find how to disable it!

Try - open the app Mobile Manager, then tap Notifications. Look for an app named Messaging and disable it. It'll prompt a confirmation and then preferably select block all. You need not worry because you could change this back to your previous setting at any time by following the same procedure.

title: Zenfone 2 - the good, the bad, and the...

thread.text:
Well this is day 7 of using my Asus Zenfone 2 4GB US version. I would like to thank Asus and AndroidCentral for giving me one to review. Frankly, I've been putting off writing this because I really want to like it more than I do and I was hoping it would grow on me. But I want to be completely honest in my review, so I do have to say that overall I have been disappointed. I won't bother to post the specs or things that have been posted many times here already as most already know that - I will just stick to my experience of it.
Now I am encouraged that two of the bugs - one major and one minor - that I've been experiencing appear to have been fixed in the update I downloaded tonight. That was what finally made me feel ready to write this since I was feeling a bit more positive after that. Hopefully the bug fixes will continue. I do know that there have been several updates so I think that is a good sign that it is being actively supported to some extent.
So to start on a positive note - the phone is quick. It handles most apps and functions easily. It matches my Note 3 in that respect. It boots quickly and most apps open relatively quickly. I've found that some games seem to freeze up for a couple seconds, however, but I haven't had a problem with functional apps that are less resource intensive. (Some games can be problems on any phone as well). So overall, good processor performance. I also like the 4GB RAM that can hold more apps open than my 3GB Note 3.
The build quality is solid, but as I and some others found out, it can be too solid. I had a terrible time getting the back cover off and actually hurt myself, ripping off both thumbnails. I'm still physically in pain from it a week later - seriously. After wrapping up my bleeding thumbs, it then took me an hour prying it off with an eyeglass screwdriver. Three other people found it impossible to open as well, even with tools, and thought I had glued it shut and was pulling a prank on them. Now as discussed in other threads, everyone didn't have this problem, but clearly there were some bad units sent out, mine included. 
The phone is heavier than expected. Not a problem at all - some people may even prefer this - but I was just surprised that it's noticeably heavier than my Note 3. I actually inadvertently threw my Note 3 because after using my Zenfone for a long period, I picked up the Note and it flew out of my hand because it felt so much lighter in comparison. I'm not considering the weight a negative - just an observation.
Asus was kind enough to include a flip cover case with the phone and I'm used to using one on my Note 3 so I do like these type of covers. It shows some useful information in the window like number of notifications, clock, calendar and some useful functions like camera, flashlight, and some quick settings. It provides some protection for the phone - minimal protection in a drop - but good protection while in a bag or pocket. I'm not a fan of the material used for cover - I prefer the Note's S-view cover - but I still like the cover and appreciate having it.
Now my biggest problem with the phone - the display. It is really poor in my opinion. I am totally open to the possibility that my unit may be worse than others since I haven't seen others complain about this, but I have no other Zenfone 2 to compare it to, so I can only base my review on the one in my hand. I really truly have a hard time looking at it. 
First, it has a pinkish hue to it. Even if I manually adjust the color settings to the opposite extreme so that everything looks very blue and green, the white backgrounds will still amazingly have a pink tint to them. I've tried every color adjustment and it won't go away. It is distinctly pink. Besides the color issue, the display is very, very, very dull. Again, this stays the same no matter the adjustments made. 
Sometimes I turn on my Note 3 screen just to look at it because looking at the Zenfone screen actually makes me sad and irritated. It also puts a great physical strain on my eyes. I didn't realize how much it was affecting me until my battery died and I switched to my Note 3 and I stopped squinting and my headache went away and I felt instantly more relaxed. This happens everytime I switch between my Zenfone 2 and my Note 3. And putting the phones side by side with the same thing on the screen, the difference in displays is absolutely ridiculous.
My second biggest issue is the battery. In my opinion, if a phone has a non-replaceable battery, it should be optimized for good battery life. This phone does not even have mediocre battery life. It has very bad battery life. On average, I get about 2 to 2 1/2 hours screen on time over an 8 hour period, with everything I can possibly shut off or disable, and with the screen on the lowest brightness setting. Even on ultra power saving mode the whole time and the screen on lowest brightness, I got just over 3 hours right off a full charge. Of course I can't use the phone that way normally - it was just a test - but that's a really bad result. I have had to constantly switch to my Note 3 because of my battery dying.
Now, if you are near an outlet, charging is a breeze. The quick charger included with the phone does a great job. Very happy with that. But, if like me you are often away from an outlet most of the daytime, you simply can't use this unless you carry multiple portable chargers with you everywhere. I could never use the Zenfone as my only phone because it simply doesn't last anywhere near long enough to get me through between charges. Because I only have one portable charger, which is not enough for this quick draining phone, I also carry my Note 3 with me everywhere, which never runs out of battery before I get home despite having a replaceable battery.
The touchscreen is also not very responsive. It's never a smooth experience. It doesn't scroll smoothly and it doesn't respond to touches consistently. I have to leave glove mode on all the time just to have it register my presses without anything covering my fingers. And even with glove mode on, it is not smooth or responsive. Lots of extra presses, hard presses, dragging and sticking - not good. This makes the lack of illumination of the softkeys even more frustrating since I have to press a dozen times minimum every time I'm trying to press one of those buttons.
I've found the software more buggy than I expected. I do give some leeway to new phones since I know some bugs just are never found until a lot of users get there hands on them. So I was not expecting a bug-free experience by any stretch. But there were more problems than expected and it leaves a not-finished impression. 
The major bug I mentioned that appears to have been fixed in the latest update is the VPN reboot bug. Anytime I connected via VPN, the phone would reboot within 1-2 minutes, making VPN unusable. For those of us who need (or want) to use a VPN connection, this is a dealbreaker. Now I only tested this once since the update, but this was the first time it did not crash and reboot, so I'm hoping it has been fixed completely but I'll need more testing.
The rather minor bug that I mentioned that seems to also be fixed is not being able to delete Gmail from the notification pulldown. It would just not ever respond if you hit delete. I just deleted my first gmail from the pulldown right before writing this, so that was good.
A few of the many other bugs are repeated crashes of the Android System UI in ultra power saving mode, particularly when it first starts. Sometimes I get 10 in the row, making the phone non-functional for long periods and it freezes for sometime after each crash as well. Not being able to send or receive MMS in the Asus messaging app with Wifi on - won't switch to data. Constant connection errors in the stock email app even though there is no problem with the connection or the email accounts. There are many other bugs but I can't list them all here. 
The auto-start manager, which I was originally very happy to see included, is a huge fail. It simply doesn't work. It does not stop the apps you mark from starting and it resets a lot of your settings upon reboot, defeating the purpose. Even the ones it does not reset, it does not stop them from starting, so it is useless. This is still true even after the update.
One Asus app I do like, that is not specific to only the Zenfone 2, is Asus PC Link. I've made a separate thread about that a few days ago so I won't repeat everything. But if you have a Windows PC (or an emulator possibly if you use another OS), you can mirror your phone and it has a couple of other cool functions. I've been using that everyday. 
The physical buttons - volume and power - have poor placement and are difficult to use. The power button is difficult to press and its placement, on top of the phone, requires you to always use two hands to press the button. The phone does have a setting to turn the screen on by tapping the screen, which I like, but when pressing the power button is needed, it's annoying. 
The volume buttons on back of the phone are very difficult to feel and I always am pressing the camera lens area instead. Most importantly, it's impossible to press the volume buttons while on a call without using two hands (assuming you are not using a headset to control volume). If you hold the phone up to your ear, there is no way to reach the volume button with that hand, which is important to be able to adjust during a phone call. 
Well there is a lot more I could write but I think this has been long enough and you get the idea. I was really expecting to like this phone. And be certain that I am keeping in mind the whole time that it is only $299 full price for this phone so I am not expecting it to match my Note 3. But the two dealbreakers for me are the poor display and the battery life. If I can't stand looking at a phone for more than a couple minutes and the battery doesn't even last me a third of the time I need it to under normal circumstances, then it just doesn't matter how inexpensive it is. 
I hope this is not seen as ungrateful since I received the phone for free. But I did agree to review it and wanted to be honest about my experience. I know several others have stated how much they like the phone, so my experience and opinion is only one, and that is why many of us were given phones for review and not just one person.

I am still customizing my phone and I am going to try to use it primarily all weekend so that I can finalize some thoughts. I will already agree that some of us received a defective back cover and I am also not impressed with the screen. It is dull. It is much duller than my Note 4. Unfortunately for this phone what I am comparing it to is the Note 4, which is top of the line. Also, my Note is with Verizon, where I get HD calling and this phone is T-Mobile, so that will be another slanted comparison. I do like that this phone is lighter than the Note 4, which is kind of a beast, but at this given moment I would never trade my Note for the Zenfone2.

Hi all I have recently bought a 64th ZenFone2. My previous device was an s5 active so screen size was my main concern with this phone. I like using a thin case on all my phones for safety reasons! can you give the complete process.? please. my ASUS zenfone 2 has been stolen.  need a reply immediately

Hey try these steps :
Add a phone number to your lost device's lock screen
If you've lost a device, you can use Android Device Manager to let anyone who finds your device call you at a different number directly from the lock screen.
Sign in to your Google Account on android.com/devicemanager.
If you have more than one device, use the arrow next to the device name to choose the lost device.
Select Lock.
In the "Phone number (optional)" field, type in a phone number where you can be reached.
Select Lock. A button to call the number you entered will be displayed on the phone's lock screen. Anyone who finds your phone will be able to dial the number from the device.
To remove the phone number, just follow the steps above and delete the number in the phone number field.

Hope your advise can help.

Double-tap to wake is a ZenMotion. Go to Settings>ZenMotion>Touch Gesture. Under Suspend Mode, there's a switch for Screen On (Double tap to wakeup).

title: Zenfone 2. Vibrating a few times every minute while charging [when on AND off]!

Hi folks,
Ok, so I've had the phone a day now and whilst charging, the damned thing keeps RANDOMLY vibrating a few times every minute when charging when powered up AND when it's charging while off! Each time it vibrates, the screen comes alive,. (while the phone is charging when on, I get the Swipe To Unlock screen and when it's off, I get the Battery Charging graphic). What POSSIBLE reason could there be for it to do this?!
Now, I know I made an absolute howler of a rookie error in my other post why my phone wouldn't connect to the net to sort out my Google account,.. (I just rebooted my modem and it worked, I'm sorry. Foolish mistake. lol),.. but THIS issue seems completely the strangest thing I haver ever encountered with a phone.
I can't see a reason why it would need to do it. Phone is not using wifi when switched off, (charging), I have only my 2G SIM card, (2nd slot) active,.. apart from that, I have no idea what might be a factor. Most of the vibrates are the short, weak ones, but then in slightly rarer instances, the phone vibrates more strongly for a second or so. It's done this contantly since I first plugged it in to charge.
Does anyone have any ideas? Is it just a Lollipop 5.0 bug or is it a 'feature' of some sort or is it that I'm using a mini-USB charge cable that the phone doesn't like, (I'm using a fairly expensive, braided, mini-USB cable)? Should I be using the USB cable that came with the phone and using it from my mains instead of my USB 2.0 port from my PC? 
I can't see what else it could be that's causing it to ramdonly vibrate as often as it is. Oh, I have seen in google searches people talking of a vibrate/sound happening when the battery fully charges,.. but my phone's vibrating, (and turning on my screen every time), when the phone's charging, but at the time of typing this, I have yet to notice if it's vibrating at all when the phone's fully completed a charge - I'll edit this when/if I notice if it does the vibrating after the phone's been fully charged.
Any help appreciated, thanks.

title: Is there any workaround in dual led to force enable both led?

thread.text: I own an asus zenfone 2 ze551ml 4gb model. while photo-shooting in average lighting or low lighting, only white led flashes up and most of time the yellow led remains off. only in rare cases the yellow led glows up. so is there any script or some workaround that can force both led to flash in photo-shooting? zentalk is of no use so i asked here with a hope. i cannot find any such queries other than zentalk except for lg g3, which is too unsolved.

As far as I know there's only one reason to amber led on these smarts that have skintone flash (amber+normal flash). It is to determinate the best tone possible when artificial light is needed and adjust the focus with accuracy. So it isn't made to iluminate the area, but only to detect the better skin tone possible on subject. 
And it works flawless on Zenfone 2. Cannot say the same for G3. Have both.
So it's normal you don't see it working. Depend on situation and not only that, but the amber led is really hard to notice because other flash is way more powerfull.

title: New on Android, need some tips

thread.text:
I was a WP user for almost 5 years and now I'm on Android. Hope you guys can help me here. 
1. Is possible to lower the vibration power on Zenfone 2 or at least choose what apps can use this or not? 
2. In the first days, battery life was fine. Really good. But now, after several of apps installed, it's draining really fast. On Windows there's a option to choose what every app can do on background and I can't find it on Android. 
3. Is there a option to block GPS for some apps or any other trick to save battery? Would be nice allow only Waze to use GPS and only when it is opened. 
4. I had a LG G3 for a couple of months before Zen 2. Whatsapp heads up notification with expanding option (swipe down to see the content of messages) worked fine, but not on Zen2. I have heads up notification, but when I swipe down, the notification bar is showed, not the message content. Is there a way to solve this? It's very annoying need to Notification to see the messages or even enter on Whatsapp. 
5. On turbo charge the charge is really fast. But on normal charge devices, even with high amperage specs like 2a, the charging is really slow. I'm getting only 800mah on 2000mah charges. On G3 I could get 1500mah! Huge difference. Is it normal? 
6. CM13 is that good? I see a lot of people that are happen with Cm13. But what are the advantages? For me Asus stock Tom is really responsive and fast.
7. I see that Android have Huge difficulties on choose between WiFi and Data. On Windows Phone it is perfect. The user don't feel any change and it's very smooth. Is there a way to make things better on Android? It's really annoying since sometimes WiFi signal is poor and the system don't change do Data immediately without loosing signal. 
I'm really happy with Zen2 device, but would be even more with some helps about these things.

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!I believe that you'd have to root the phone for this. There are a few apps on Google Play that say they can adjust vibration strength, like Vibration Intensity, but it doesn't get very good reviews. For most apps that give you notifications, you can select whether it vibrates or not by opening the app, tapping Menu>Settings, and looking for Notification options.To determine what's using battery drain, it can be useful to see battery stats. Charge up to 100%, then let it drain to 20-30% with normal usage, without charging in between. Then show us:
1. The main Settings>Battery screen.
2. The fullscreen battery graph screen (which shows Awake time and Cell Signal Strength).
3. The Screen category (to see total Screen On time).
4. The Cell Standby category, if present (to see Time Without Signal).http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-central.html
You might have to install a 3rd party battery monitor, like GSam Battery Monitor, to get the Cell Signal Strength graph.
There's no native option in Android to control what an app does in the background. There are 3rd party apps that will force close apps in the background to "clean RAM," but this is unnecessary and often detrimental to how the system works. Android is designed to keep RAM mostly full of open apps, so that apps can be opened or switched to quickly and efficiently. If the app you want isn't already open, the system will close an app on its own to clear up enough RAM for the new app. So do yourself a favor and stay away from apps like Clean Master!If your phone is on Marshmallow, then you can go to Settings>Apps, select the app, tap Permissions, and turn off Location or GPS permission. Personally, I always keep my Location service set to Battery Saving (i.e., using wi-fi and mobile data only), and only change it to High Accuracy (i.e., with GPS) when I need precise location, like when using the Navigation feature in Maps.Have you tried different USB cables and charging plugs?
Hopefully others can weigh in on your other questions. Enjoy!

Welcome to Android Central!I believe that you'd have to root the phone for this. There are a few apps on Google Play that say they can adjust vibration strength, like Vibration Intensity, but it doesn't get very good reviews. For most apps that give you notifications, you can select whether it vibrates or not by opening the app, tapping Menu>Settings, and looking for Notification options.To determine what's using battery drain, it can be useful to see battery stats. Charge up to 100%, then let it drain to 20-30% with normal usage, without charging in between. Then show us:
1. The main Settings>Battery screen.
2. The fullscreen battery graph screen (which shows Awake time and Cell Signal Strength).
3. The Screen category (to see total Screen On time).
4. The Cell Standby category, if present (to see Time Without Signal).http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-central.html
You might have to install a 3rd party battery monitor, like GSam Battery Monitor, to get the Cell Signal Strength graph.

Phone was NEVER subjected to any physical damage like falling from height or contact with water, NOR was done anything related to software other than regular upgades for the latest software version and wipe cache paritions after updates (cannot be done for the last update, since the phone does not allow to go to recover mode as mentioned in pt 4)

No different from any other phone. Class 10 or better, reputable manufacturer (Samsung, SanDisk, PNY, Kingston), and reputable seller to avoid getting a knockoff.

thread.text:

Posted via Android Central App

replies.text: Here's a really well written and informative explanation answering your question!

thread.text:
You can go up to 128gb as well
Posted via the Android Central App

1. I recommend SanDisk. Samsung is probably just as good, but SanDisk invented the technology and are always on top of it. (When Samsung released an update that didn't handle the SD card properly, SanDisk came out with a modified card that would still work - before Samsung had even acknowledged that there was a problem.) They're also a very easy company to work with, have an on-line chat manned by knowledgeable people, answer emails promptly (like an email I sent on Sunday night that I received an answer to by 10 AM Monday morning - and that was 7 AM their time).
2. Samsung and SanDisk make the chips that are inside the card. Everyone else buys from them. Are they always getting the best chips? Who knows? And if there's a problem who do they blame, themselves or the chip manufacturer? Samsung and SanDisk are "single-source" - if it doesn't work, it's their fault.
3. Up to HD video, a Class 10 (or U1 - same thing, different nomenclature) is fast enough. For 4k you need a U3 (there's no "Class 30").
I've been buying SanDisk since cards were measured in MB (I still use a 256MB card all the time for small files, I used to have a 32MB card, but darned if I know where it is, but it worked the last time I used it) and the only one I ever had a problem with was one I cracked. (The 256MB card is WAY out of warranty, but it still works.)

Could this card be the problem or the camera/gallery app? Thinking about buying a U3 card for $54, but not if it won't solve the problem. Appreciate the input of pros.
Thanks,
Zara

replies.text: You need to find someone at ATT who knows what they are doing. They can put it in the system as LTE. If ATT doesn't sell the phone, it is not automatically in the system as LTE.

Easiest way to do this is to put your AT&T SIM card in an AT&T approved LTE device, and register that IMEI with AT&T on the website. Once that's done, you will be provisioned for LTE, and you can drop the SIM card in the ZF2 and you'll get LTE. be sure the APN is correctly set and enabled...I had to go into APN settings and turn on the "phone" APN. for more info try here: Programming non-AT&T devices with the correct APN and MMS data settings- AT&T Wireless Support

thread.text:

AT&T's Customer Service Phone Number: 1-800-331-0500
(You may need a new sim card and have AT&T activate our ZenFone 2 (ZE551ML) on AT&T’s high speed 4G network)

I've never heard of that. I used another phone on my account to set up my wife's ZF2, and it still gets LTE. This was several months ago. The IMEI is just used to initially provision the line, as far as I can tell. If the IMEI you're using has changed subsequently, so what? The SIM is already set up for your line. That's a key feature of the GSM standard and its derivatives, really...
Sounds great to me ccontard

I bought a Zen2, went to AT&T with my Galaxy 5 and asked to add a new phone to my account and needed a SIM. They told me that if they put a different SIM in my G5 that my original SIM would be burned as they match the SIM and IMEI for security. I think she said stolen phones. Is this true? My wife's Galaxy 6 uses a nanoSIM. My work phone G5 uses a Micro like the Zen2, so I need to use theG5, but can't mess up my work account as it is through the company. Will my work account or SIM be at risk if I use its IMEI to register a new SIM for the Zen2 as AT&T claims? Thanks

BrownHay,
I see. However you don't need to use your G5 SIM card. You can activate service on your wife's nano SIM from G6 and then buy SIM card adapter from Amazon for under $7 and put nano SIM in to adapter and use it in Zen2. As you are going from Nano to Micro, you should be all set. Hope this helps. Best luck!
Worked as described and both the original G5 SIM and new SIM still work. Thanks for the help.

Is there still an issue with activating a new zen2 directly with Att? I have a friend who may purchase a new zen2 to replace her current phone but I don't think she will want to fool with swapping sims. Probably she would want to just walk in the Att store with her old and new phone and ask them to switch service to the new phone.

As lot of people have pointed out, Zenfone 2 doesn't support LTE right out of the box. In order to get LTE, you have to register SIM card against phone with IMEI number that supports LTE and then use that SIM card in Zenfone 2. I do not believe your friend can just walk with Zenfone 2 in ATT store and get LTE service after activation. It is worth a try though. Best luck!

You shouldn't need another IMEI to get LTE working on AT&T. I have a US Zenfone 2 Deluxe (you do need a US variant, the world edition is missing some AT&T bands). The default APN on my device was phone, which doesn't support LTE. I set it to NEXTGENPHONE. I lost all connectivity on that APN, so I contacted support, I gave them my real IMEI and my phone is working just fine on LTE now.

title: Random restart during music and stock earphones

thread.text:
I'm using the 4GB/64GB version.
My phone suddenly dies(no screen, no sound, no response with buttons, no led lighting up with charging etc.) and just restarts with the asus and loading icon shown first affer a minute or so. It looks basically dead before it restarts.
I notice that it only happens when my screen is off and I'm just pressing the button on the stock earphones to switch music tracks or pause it. It doesn't happen on other circumstances.

Can you test other headphones to see if it happens with those as well? If they do, then it may be a problem with the headphone jack, or possibly the firmware. What firmware version is the phone on right now?

It didn't happen on my older earphones, which also don't have mics or buttons. I used the stock one, because the old ones broke.
IDK if it's related but it started when I set the audio wizard to video mode. I'm trying it on smart mode now. Also, I kinda dropped my phone before. Caught it with my shoe, but the floor hit the really upper left part, breaking the tempered glass cover only. The restarts didn't happen and I was still using my old earphones there. I also tried different players and it still happened.
Is this my firmware? I also just got this update, hope the error doesn't happen now.
Difficult to say. The recent trauma does raise the question of a hardware problem. See what happens with the new update.

Sadly, it happened again. It really only happens when I'm using the mic button to pause/switch tracks(with the screen turned off, I guess).
It doesn't happen in any other circumstance like music playing, games, videos. I'll try pressing the mic button on these if anything happens. 
IDK if it's a software problem or hardware problem with the earphones or slot.

I tried playing a game then repeatedly pressed the mic button on the earphones. Nothing happened.
I turned the screen off, then pressed it again repeatedly. Then wow, it died then restarted again. I guess, it's something with the screen turned off and the mic button?
UPDATE: I removed my music players(default and mxplayer). I tried the spam-mic-button thing while the screen was off during a running game. No restart. 
I realized too that the music player opens up when I continuously press the mic button, even when the music player app is closed. I guess the the restart is related to the process of switching/pausing tracks?

I'm glad you were able to narrow it down to the mute button. If I had to guess, I'd wonder if the trauma messed up one of the headphone jack connections somehow, such that the mute button signal is causing some kind of short in the power circuits. All I can suggest at this point is to avoid that button (or get headphones that don't have any remote control buttons).

That's what I was also thinking with the circuits and stuff. I tested again and it happened again even if the players were uninstalled. It's really the pressing of the mic button. Although it was with the screen turned off and a game running. I'll try with just the home screen and the screen on.
I'll try other earphones with buttons, in the future. It's really more convenient, compared to ones without.

title: How to change layout of external / physical bluetooth keyboard?

thread.text: I can successfully bluetooth pair the bluetooth keyboard and use it. However, I would like to change the bluetooth keyboard layout to a different one. Googling reveals that Android should have a sub menu in the 'Settings', 'Language & input' menu called 'Physical Keyboard'... but on the Zenfone 2 there is no sign of it. Interestingly, if I navigate to 'Language & input' and click on the search icon in the top right hand corner, and then type 'physical' and the result pops up 'Physical keyboard'. If I click on the result then it takes me to the 'Language & input' menu... but there is no 'Physical keyboard' sub-menu :-( Is this a bug in Lollipop or the Zenfone 2? How to change the bluetooth keyboard layout? Or how to get the 'Physical Keyboard' menu to appear?

Hi simonhf,
Not sure how close to stock android your phone is, but I can confirm that in Settings > Language & input under the Keyboard & input methods there is a Physical keyboard section that allows you to click on your bluetooth keyboard and select your keyboard layout for the physical keyboard, I'm using Sony Z3.
If you still can't locate the settings, there's an app available in the Play Store called External Keyboard Helper Demo/Pro, that I'm currently using which I'm finding extremely useful, it gives you the option of selecting a keyboard layout for your bluetooth keyboard (it also works for USB keyboards) and you can create application and text shortcuts and remap your keys to other characters.

thread.text:
There are some very good comments here. I needed a phone with max RAM because I do a lot of multi-tasking between apps and found my 2gb phone kept closing apps that I needed. This really shouldn't be a problem with Android being able to handle memory correctly, but when an app isn't written well, they'll crash when Android closes them and I get a crash error. Having this problem all the time working between apps is just a pain. And at the same time I can't afford the $600-$800 phones that have more RAM. For some strange reason I wanted to see if anyone made a 4gb phone so I googled it and found this phone. I was absolutely shocked to find one with 4gb RAM and 64gb storage for only $300 on Amazon. This is unheard of and I didn't hesitate to buy it at that price. I even read the reviews, 4.5 stars with 800+ reviews, wow! This phone also comes with the MicroSD slot capable for a 64gb card, although I've read people have even used a 128gb card successfully. 
My two cons, but only personal cons. The phone is too large for me. I like smaller phones that I can easily carry on my side and fit in one hand. My Samsung Galaxy Avant is the perfect size and I would go with the iPhone 5S if I had the money and wasn't already an android fan. But there's not a small phone on the market with this type of horsepower and at this price level. I seriously looked at the Sony Xperia Z3 compact, but decided against it due to cost and Sony just doesn't seem to be hanging into the cellphone market. 
The second con is the embedded battery. I swore I'd never buy a phone with a non-removable battery. I'm the type who doesn't replace his electronic devises every two years, and I can't see sending it in for replacement, what a gimmick. However, I needed more RAM and at this price I couldn't turn it down. 
I cannot validate the complaints of battery heat and poor battery life. There's some heat from the battery and the battery doesn't last all day long, but that's because I'm a very heavy user. Nothing worse than any other phones I've had. 
Overall, I completely recommend this phone, the 4gb model. If Asus keeps this quality up at this price point, they're going to do some serious damage to the other high-priced phone manufacturers.
Posted via the Android Central App

No heat issues here, only time it gets toasty is while quick charging. People overreact to heat they feel the phone warm up a little bit and jump on the overheating train, when it's just normal smartphone tempetures. The battery is average in my experience I get about 4 hours on screen and the device lasts me a full day so I can't complain. My biggest complaint is the camera which is mediocre at best.

I have the 4GB/64GB version and it doesn't drain the battery fast, and doesn't get hot. It really depends on which model since there are numerous versions of the ZF2. Amazon offers the higher end model I mentioned for less than $300 OTD, try it, if you don't like it send it back and get a refund.

This phone runs a lot cooler than my LG G3 did. Only if I'm really taxing the processor do things get reasonably warm.
As for battery, it definitely isn't the best, but it's better than something like the Galaxy S6. I get around 4.5 hours of screen-on time, and of course the quick charging works very well. 
Overall, there are going to be compromises when you are looking at a $200-$300 phone. For me, the Zenfone 2 works amazingly well for its price point. Really, my only gripe is that the camera app can be sluggish at times.

I had hopes of my Zenphone replacing my Nexus 5. After using it a couple weeks, its a long way from it. Battery isn't much better, the screen is way too dark for my old eyes, after using stock android the Asus UI is a mess, forcing me to have a whole raft of options in the pulldown menu is stupid if I only want three. One thing I'd thought I wouldn't miss so much is the color changing notification LED. MAN I miss that from my Nexus. Zenphone just dumbly flashed green and you don't know WHAT the notification is. 
Worst part- screen is FRAGILE. I have had mobile phones since the analog bag phone days, and the Zenphone was the easiest phone to crack the screen, the FIRST smartphone I have ever damaged. Short spill onto a tile floor...CRACK. Sent it back to Asus, they still have it and want close to a third of the cost of the phone to fix it. With my overall dissatisfaction with the device in the first place, I asked them to return the phone unrepaired Thursday. I'll use it cracked while I figure out what device comes next. Maybe Moto. 
Just one old man's opinion.
So ya drop a smartphone (with no case??) on a TILE floor and you don't expect it to CRACK!!? Seriously?
$12.99 would have saved you a lot of grief.http://www.amazon.ca/ZenFone-Wallet-Leather-Pockets-5-5-inch/dp/B00X67CLJC/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1439860263&sr=8-3&keywords=zenfone+2+case

Had a case. One of the clear plastic jobs. Was waiting on my armored case, which came in the day AFTER I dropped the phone. 
And yes, every phone I have ever had has survived what the Zenphone didn't. Blackberry, HTC Evo, Moto Atrix, Note 1, Nexus 5, ALL survived much worse drops than the Zenphone did. May have been just dumb luck. In any case I am not smitten with the phone anyway, its not the game changer I expected it to be. I am using a ZTE ZMAX right now while I wait on the ZF to get back, its brighter, almost as fast, and has KILLER battery life. If it had 5.1, It would be my DD.

I don't know if the ZF2 is much worse or better at surviving drops than the average smartphone, but a lot depends on what part lands first. Sometimes we are just unlucky :-(. I hope you will have better luck with your next phone!

title: Asus Zenfone 2 with Tmobile Data Connection issues, help?

thread.text:
I have the Asus Zenfone 2 ze550ml, since August 2015. I love it, great phone...blah blah blah.
I've had Tmobile service (switched from MetroPCS) since February. When I first switched I was getting H+ speeds and my speedtest app was saying I was getting 25mbps. 2 weeks ago, I stopped getting the H+ symbol and now only get 3g. The 3g speeds are TERRIBLE! .33 Down and .4 up. I've contacted Tmobile NUMEROUS times and they all give me the run around and put in a "ticket" with the promise that they will call me back in 3 days with an update. 
The last person told me that they may have updated their towers and since I'm using a "world" phone (her words) it no longer works with Tmobile. I showed her my phone's specs to prove that my phone is, in fact, 4g compatible with Tmobile, and she quickly rushed me off of the phone. 
I live in the middle of a large city, in the middle of a huge coverage zone. I'm at a loss of what to do next. I love this phone, and I don't think I should have to buy a tmobile phone to get network data. I've changed, reset, double checked all of my APN settings and I still can't get better than this garbage 3g.

Welcome to Android Central! Which APN are you using? Make sure it's the T-Mobile GPRS (fast.t-mobile.com) one.
When you say you reset, do you mean you did a factory reset of the phone, or was that in reference to the APN?

fast.t-mobile.com
I have no factory reset the phone, just the APN

What REALLY makes me angry is that, when I had service through MetroPCS, I had no data issues. I moved to TMobile because I thought I would get better quality with my phone calls. I'd much rather have good data and crappy phone calls. MetroPCS is a prepaid service that utilizes Tmobile towers, so I honestly don't know what the deal is.

Try wiping the cache partition: New Steps to Wipe Cache in Zenphone 2-ZE551ML. If that doesn't help, it might be worth trying a factory reset.
Also, ask T-Mobile for a replacement SIM card. If that works, then I'd ask them to refund the cost of the new card, since in that case, the previous card they gave you must have been defective.

title: App went totally missing from ZenUI Launcher.

thread.text: The Asus Messaging app is now suddenly missing in the ZenUI launcher in my ZF2. I can't find it anywhere in the launcher! Not in my home screen, not in the all apps drawer. Hey check the same under safe mode for safe mode press the power button => hold the power button => now you will get an option to reboot to safe mode do that check for the App.

Welcome to Android Central! I agree with contacting ASUS for a replacement, assuming it's under warranty. That all sounds like a defective phone.

imgur photo:

If you removed the app from the homescreen, then you only removed the app shortcut. It doesn't uninstall the app--you'll still find it in the Settings>Apps list.

Welcome to Android Central! Have you been deleting contacts in the Contacts app, or in your Google Contacts in the cloud?
I deleted my pre existing contacts in the Asus Contacts App.

What's the notification that won't go away? I'm not sure if your thread title got edited somehow, but you don't mention anywhere what the notification says.
Were those contacts saved to the local Phone account, or in your Google account in the cloud?

The notification is "Sync: Too many contacts deletes". I think they were saved via the cloud because I didn't import them, nor did I ask for them. I was trying to delete them so it would just be my phone contacts. It's a bit annoying to have it do that by default.

If you don't want your cloud contacts to show, you can open Contacts and tap Menu>Contacts to Display>Customize to select which accounts to show. You can also go to Settings>Accounts-Google>[your account]​, and uncheck Contacts, which will unsync your Google Contacts from the phone's Contacts app.

Unless your battery level is being reported inaccurately, this is not necessary. If you discharge a lithium battery deeply on a regular basis, it could decrease the overall lifespan of the battery.

title: I am confused, can I get some help?

thread.text: Ok, here goes. I have a Zen fone 2 laser, unlocked from amazon. It is running on Crickets network. It never shows LTE, just 4g or H, or G, or E, or H+ . Some of you are saying I have to change my APN to something other then what Cricket set me up with and some of you are saying that even though it doesn't show LTE that it really is LTE. I live in a LTE area and also it is never any different no matter where I go. So what is it ?? Do I have LTE even though it doesn't show it or not ???? At the bottom of my APN settings there is something called "Bearer" and it is set to Unspecified. I changed it to LTE and made no difference so I changed it back. If I go to Settings and then to "About Phone" and then to Status and look at Cellular network type, it says LTE. What does that mean??

Hi, have a read at this article, it was quite interesting - 4G vs. LTE | The differences explained | Digital Trends
so what do Crickets say when you call them? I know my phone supports 4G LTE, but it only displays 4G on the phone.
When I inserted my Cricket SIM into my new ZF2, it automatically loaded all of the APN and other settings. The indicator usually is 4G but changes to H+ when making a call; that's normal.
The "4G" icon is simply how the ZF2 represents that you have an LTE connection. There's nothing wrong with the phone or the network.

I'm getting ready to leave Verizon wireless for Cricket and I don't want to spend a ton of cash on a flagship. I currently have the Note 2 on verizon, so I want a similarly sized phone with a better camera. The camera on the Note 2 is terrible. I don't think i've ever been able to get a non-blurry picture. My wife's M7 is light years ahead of it in the camera department. I realize that the Blu Pure XL isn't out yet, but I was hoping to start the discussion to see if people have already written it off or are considering a change. I'm leaning towards the Zenfone purely based on price (probably get one used on swappa or something). 
thanks.
Blu Pure XL should be quite competitive. The camera on the Zenfone 2 was so-so. Also the bloatware on the Zenfone 2 is horrendous...good luck.
I'm quite happy with the Zenfone2 camera...pic I took last weekend.

Great photos, but nothing is moving (kids, dogs, etc) and the lighting is perfect (not in a bar or at night). I'm not too worried about the camera on the zenfone (it can't be worse than my Note), more about the bloatware mentioned earlier. $350 is a lot to pay for a phone with questionable support...but then it's really cheap for a phone with a killer display. I've got a month before my vz contract is up, so hopefully there are some real world reviews by then.
No sure why folks get so worked up about "bloatware" It's super easy to disable/remove it and move on. It's a non-issue in my opinion.

Bloatware is not a problem almost all can be disabled or uninstalled, unlike the loads of crap on my Samsung tablet.
Camera to me is the weakest feature.

I'm tempted and waiting for the RMA instructions for the exchange of my Zenfone2 right now. If the exchange doesn't resolve my problem, I can see myself returning the Zenfone2 and going after the Blu Pure XL, and had the Pure XL been on the market already, it would have been the one I'd have gotten because of the screen size. The 5.5 Zenfone2 is still okay, but I definitely prefer the larger screens. As for bloatware, it can be disabled-the functionality of the Zenfone is fine and I can speak to that. I like the phone very much and prefer to at this point be able to keep it since I already have it, but the issue for me is that I have two phone lines, and the second SIM slot on mine does not pick up a reliable signal in my home, but it works 99% everywhere else, so my concern is that it's not a hardware problem, but I'm asking for an exchange anyway just to see. I need to be able to receive calls on that second line and I can't when I'm at home, so clearly that's a huge problem. The signal drops left and right. Calls fail or can't be initiated in the first place-my SIM 2 sometimes totally X's out. Even when it doesn't, when I'm at home it's practically useless. Meantime I have no problem with the other SIM slot at all. There is a notion that it is connected to the fact that the Zenfone's second SIM slot only supports 2G and somehow this still is connected to phone calls as well, and if that's the case, my house must not like a 2G only SIM slot! So as long as BOTH the Blu Pure XL's SIM slots support all the higher bands, then I should be fine. 
Asus does put out regular firmware updates and there is a pretty active user forum, so I am otherwise pleased with the Zenfone. I don't know a lot about Blu and what kind of firmware support they offer.
System updates will be few and far between on BLU products....

People are saying the camera is weak - it's not bad. I've taken a lot of really nice shots. It's not as automatic as some cameras. It will tell you to switch to HDR or night mode. That's not automatic. 
I love my Zenfone. Updates have fixed a lot of the early issues. The battery is still just okay and the screen isn't a Samsung, but the launcher is slowly improving and I'm happy with the updates. They are definitely working on improving the phone all the time. 
Also, it's wicked fast. I haven't had an issue with lag. Period.
Posted via the Android Central App

So my replacement ZF2 is on the way and my original is en route back. I'm using my Note 3 in the interim with calls being forwarded from my second line to my main number until my new ZF2 arrives. I will hope that my problems with SIM 2 reception in my home were due to a faulty device somehow. I sure hope it works out and is fine. It is still a question mark as to what the real cause of poor call reception was-2G data in the SIM slot? People on AT&T forums theorize, but an AT&T rep told me that would not cause call reception problems, so who knows. If reception is fine on the replacement, then I'll know it was a defective phone. If not, then, the question will still remain. It still in any event is strange that my SIM 2 is virtually unusable in my house but then works fine almost everywhere else-that still points to something that doesn't sound 100% like a defective device, just very strange, but if a new device resolves the issue, I'll be quite happy, and I really hope that will take care of it. Now-to the point of responsibility for their product--- In the short several weeks I've owned the phone, I've had regular updates, so I do appreciate that Asus stays on top of that which is one thing in their favor. As long as my calls work on SIM 2, I will be good to go. I do confess I like the larger screen size but that's my eyes more than anything (I need reading glasses-it's nice to be able to glance sometimes without needing glasses). I'm also fine with the Zen UI-it doesn't bother me. Only thing is now I have to order another screen protector. I had a glass one that had the cutout to not interfere with the proximity sensor. I don't think re-using will work too well. Such is life.
I heard they are coming out with a Zen 3 soon? Is this a rumor? Thanks

replies.text: I'm pretty sure that's a rumor, no news I've seen as a direct successor, however there is the new $229 4GB z3560 model out now and in October we should be seeing the Zenfone 2 Zoom, Max, Laser, and Deluxe models on the shelves...

thread.text:
No interest in any Moto products?
Posted via the Android Central App

Well-my replacement has arrived and so far, it's only been a day I've had it on, and it seems better, although the two SIM slots at home don't show an equal signal like they do everywhere else like on my original phone. I haven't received any calls yet as it's the weekend and my second line, so it's too early to know for sure, but I made a few outbound calls and called into the voice mail as a test and it seems better though I am still seeing the second SIM X out on me at times for a brief second. When I go to check my voice mail, it skips the message too which is weird, which again, I wonder is due to reception issues. It then does go to the skipped message. I'm off work this week but will have my phone out and about to test in multiple locations. Right now the signal strength on SIM 1 is 3 bars at home and SIM 2 is only at 1 bar. I'm not too encouraged by that. What in the world can be so off with the reception in my house for that second sim slot? It works everywhere else okay. If it truly has some connection to the fact that SIM 2 only supports 2G data, then this will support me going after the Blu phone . AT&T claims that the 2G slot should have nothing to do with call reception though. Who knows-but then why is it the one with the problem, and why only at my house?

Update. Things have worsened and are a no go for me. I'm planning on the Pure XL for sure now. MY SIM 2 has reverted to unusable like before. Replacement phone, replacement SIM doesn't matter. 2G is the issue. My area is too up to date obviously that 2G slots are too outdated. I plan to get the Pure XL which I believe has both LTE SIM slots.I'm very disappointed. I really like the ZF2 and wish this wasn't the case, but I can't use the second sim line on it when I'm anywhere near my home which renders things quite useless since I got this so that I could have both phone numbers on it. Today I got a new SIM card again, the firmware is up to date, though I have kept it up to date the whole time, it's a replaced ZF2 and all, and the problem is even worse. AT&T confirmed that the 2G slot is the problem. So this phone clearly is not usable as a dual SIM for me, and is going back to ASUS and I have to now take it up with them. But this now puts the Pure XL in prime position. I actually like the larger screen anyway, although at this point since I had the ZF2 already and was happy otherwise, I really wanted to just have that work out but it didn't. It's foolish that they put 2G in there so people might want to take note that. I didn't think it would matter just for phone calls and boy in my case have I been sadly mistaken. I can get calls in a lot of places, but I can't in and around my own home and it's a place I need to be able to on my second number so the phone has to go back, period. I can go back to my Note 3 and Windows phone until the Pure XL comes in. I'll have to get a nano SIM again for the Windows phone, and then another SIM when the Pure XL comes in, but that's life. Either that or forward my calls again like I did last week when I waited for the replacement ZF2.

Blu does look like a nice phone, but I fear Blu won't offer many (if any truly worthwhile ) updates at all based on some reviews I've read online.
Sample review info:Good luck and I hope it works out. Thankfully I'm very happy with my Zen and have zero need for a second SIM card.

Hey there-yeah-count yourself VERY fortunate you don't need that second SIM slot. Once an area is upgraded, look out. In my case, thankfully things worked out-but that's because Amazon did right by me. I was outside of the timeframe for returns but they recognized that it was genuinely a problem that I couldn't have become aware of until the timing I did, because I was getting calls on SIM 2 fine in areas 30 miles west of where I live, thinking my phone was fine, but then when I started getting calls later in the day when I was actually at HOME, but , a few weeks later, that's when I found out that things were NOT fine. I had no way of knowing. And I had changed SIM cards twice and gone through a full RMA and several support chat sessions with AT&T so Amazon could see I really tried. But in the end, AT&T concluded that my area is upgraded and the 2G towers are shutting down bit by bit and therefore I'm not going to get a reliable connection in that 2G slot and that even includes just for phone calls. Well, that's totally worthless. It's disappointing as it's a great phone otherwise for those who only need one number. But as a dual SIM, let me tell you-it does not work and ASUS needs to make their next one with double LTE slots or just make it single SIM, period and lower the price because they are duping people into thinking it is functional as a dual SIM when there are people like me in upgraded tower areas. I wasted so much time with this, and ASUS doesn't think they owed me anything back. Amazon thank goodness thought of the customer experience. What is ASUS thinking of making that second SIM 2G? title: como solucionar la falla flickering sccren of mi asus zenfone 2

thread.text:
Good morning, someone can advise me on how to fix this flaw, I would appreciate it
Cheers

Flickering screens can be tough to diagnose without a picture or a video of the defect. What exactly does it look like? Most of the time, however, flickering screens mean that there's a hardware issue with your device (loose connector, damaged display panel, etc.) and that might need repairs, not a quick software/settings fix, unfortunately. 
(Como el título está en español, también podemos ayudar en ese idioma si lo necesitas  )

I would appreciate it
Cheers

Thanking his support, would like to see the possibility if I can advise how to disarm my asus zenfone 2 and check what you mention me, be possible that I can teach these steps?, And abusing their trust, could advise me on how to check if any part is damaged, it is unclear whether worn or burnt is assumed to be that but if the pieces are not damaged mention as I know if do not work, I have basic knowledge in electronics
best regards

I really can't help with how to open a phone (haven't done that in years) so your best bet would be to take it to a specialized shop, as opening it yourself can prove tricky and if not skilled enough, you might make things worse. 
But there are a few things you can try to see if it's software. 
1) When you see the flickering, take a screenshot. Does the 'flicker' show up in the image as well? If so, it's 100000% certain it's software. 
2) Run your phone in Safe Mode. This disables any 3rd party app from loading at boot. Does the flicker happen? If it doesn't, then we know that it's software AND that it's caused by an app you have installed. We can figure out which one also in Safe Mode by opening apps and seeing which one is the culprit. 
3) Boot your phone in Recovery Mode. This skips the OS entirely and goes straight to the basic system. Does the screen flicker there? If it does, then it's fairly certain that it's a hardware issue. Did you drop your phone recently?

It’s name may be more than a mouthful, but the ZenFone 2 Deluxe Special Edition is here. Many of you have been waiting eagerly for this device because it is the granddaddy of the ZenFone 2 family. Let’s take a quick look at what’s inside.
Packaging – Who doesn’t love carbon fiber?
Before we roll out the red carpet, I wanted to compliment our design team on the packaging. It has a smooth carbon fiber wrapping and the ZenFone 2 Deluxe logo is stamped on the top along with words Special Edition on the angled corner. When we open up the packaging, we have the phone, charging adapter, extra back cover, and documentation. The team did a great job with this and it gives a really nice experience.
Hardware – More storage and more back covers!
Let’s get into the phone, shall we? In terms of the upgrades, the Special Edition features an extra 64GB of onboard storage (for a total of 128GB), that means you can take up to an extra 45,000 pictures! Also, everyone’s been asking about back covers, and how much they loved the Deluxe’s 3D back cover that changed from purple, to blue, and then teal. This time, the Special Edition offers TWO exclusive back covers! One has a sleek carbon-fiber styling that gives it that extra tough look. The other is a faceted style, like the Deluxe’s, but instead comes in a smooth and shiny metallic silver. It feels great in the hand and isn’t slippery.
Software – Red and Black is hot.

You will need ADB,fastboot installed in your system to do this.
Pre-rooted system.img and recovery (send me a message for download link, since i can not post it here) (Download the correct firmware according to your phone ZE550ML = Z008 , ZE551ML = Z00A ) CHECK THE LABEL OF THE BACK OF YOUR PHONE FOR THIS.
Download and run WinRAR . Click on the '.zip' part of the system.img file. You will see that WinRAR puts all the parts together and offers you an option to extract the one big system.img. Go ahead and extract it to the folder the other parts of the ROM are in.
boot.img (~ 11MB)
droidboot.img (~ 13MB)
recovery.img (~ 11MB)
system.img (~ 2GB)
Disconnect your phone from PC/Laptop.. Power it off. Once it is off, hold down the volume up button and hold on to the power button until the phone vibrates. After the vibration stops, release the power button and continue pressing the volume up button until the green Android robot appears. You should see a blue line below saying "Waiting Fastboot command or Continue the fastboot process"
Now connect your phone via USB to your computer.
Open a terminal or a command prompt in the directory where you extracted the files.
Copy and paste the following commands in the command prompt window (line by line) and press enter after each line. WAIT for the process to complete before copying and pasting the next line:
Code:
fastboot flash fastboot droidboot.img
fastboot flash recovery recovery.img
fastboot flash boot boot.img
fastboot flash system system.img
The flashing of system.img will take huge time to show any text after max size info,after some more time it will show finished ,then you can plug out the USB and press the power button, reboot your phone and when it starts up, your phone is ROOTED.
Now open Supersu[it will ask for su binary update,click NO],and click unroot from options of supersu,reboot once
Now u have stock without any modification.

Bump! Anyone?

Install KDEConnect on your android device from Play Market.
To install KDE Connect for*any desktop environment*simply type the following commands into the terminal. (CTRL + Alt + T)
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:vikoadi/ppa
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install kdeconnect indicator-kdeconnect*
Once it is installed, simply run "KDE Connect Indicator" from the applications menu, or type "indicator-kdeconnect" in the terminal.

Way, way simple.... get a gmail account, upload all of your files to your free google drive from your phone's web browser (chrome isn't the fastest browser, but it will let you transfer entire folders at one time - rather than one file at a time). USE WiFi unless have mobile data to burn.....
Then log onto your desktop's web browser and log into your google drive account. Download the files that you want.
I don't even carry a USB thumbdrive around anymore (well, there is one on my keychain but rarely used).
p.s. my current fave browser for speed and GUI is chromium (synaptic package manager will load it for you on your desktop).

title: Looking for smartphone recommendations. Any suggestions?

thread.text:
Hello all, so my current phone is having issues, and I need to upgrade (it's pretty outdated anyways).
So, I want to get a new android phone, and need some recommendations, there are a few things I'd like and am having trouble choosing.
First of all, the asus zenfone 2 caught my eye, probably because I have an asus gaming laptop, and a powerfull phone would be nice, although apparently the cameras are not so good. None of the local providers here have asus products, so I wouldn't be able to get it on contract either, that means paying out full price which would be tricky at this point in time.
Anyways as I said there are some features I'd really like, and some I could compromise on.
Wireless charging - I would like that, however it's not super critical, and if the phone has some sort of fast charge technology like the asus, that would be fine. I guess aside from saving the connector, having an iphone before means wearing out cables gets expensive, but not with micro usb.
SD Card - the latest galaxy phones got rid of the SD card slot, which is a big, big no no, on a budget, and on principle, I don't want to have to pay a load of money to get chipped memory when you can buy micro SD cards so much cheaper.
USB host functionality - I deal with moving data around a lot, and being able to use the phone to hook up to flash drives (or even external hard drives, with an external power adapter of course) is critical, I'm not sure what android phones are like for this, or if some manufacturers don't allow this functionality.
So, if someone could offer some advice/point me in the right direction that would be fantastic.

title: I want to switch from iPhone 5s to Asus Zenfone2 4gb ram 32gb, its a good or bad step ?

thread.text: i want to switch from iphone 5s to asus zenfone2 4gb ram 32gb its a good or bad step ?
Definitely a good step. It's a newer device, a lot cheaper and it's Android
Not too much familiar with Zenfone2. Need to research a little bit.

It's a mix of both actually.
The good side is, you'll experience better performance. My Zenfone 2 opens apps faster than my iPhone 6 and it also finishes tasks faster. It's as fluid as the iPhones and overall it seems faster.
The bad side is, though it has a much bigher screen with higher resolution, the display quality isn't as good as the retina displays of the iPhones. It also doesn't get very bright in direct sunlight. In the indoors it's not a problem.
Plus the audio quality output through headphones isn't as good as the 5s. You'll have a worse music listening experience.
If you don't care about the display and music quality, then you should definitely go for it without any second thought!

I just received my 4GB/64GB review model from ASUS yesterday as part of winning the video contest here. A big reason why I was picked, I believe, was that I was previously carrying around three phones: a work phone, a personal phone, and an Android phone I used as a media player. I thought I'd share a few things I've found after transferring both my SIM cards to the Zenfone2. FWIW, my SIM1 is my AT&T work SIM, since they pay for a big data plan, and my SIM2 is a T-Mobile SIM tied to my personal phone number. 
Phone-wise everything is more or less okay from what I can tell. Incoming and outgoing calls go as expected. The built in dialer seems pretty good, maybe even great. You have to choose which SIM to use every time you dial, which is a bit annoying, but I'm sure I'll get used to it. It would be nice if there was a way to permanently mark a contact as a SIM1 or SIM2 contact, but if it exists I haven't found it. I still haven't tried a bluetooth call from my car, but I'm hoping incoming and outgoing calls will be handled easily. 
One not-so-shocking phone related thing I noticed was the T-Mobile's visual voicemail app doesn't work with the 
Text messages are a little more complicated. The built in ASUS SMS app is pretty decent and has a buttons to send from either SIM1 or SIM2. Previously I was using EvolveSMS which I loved, but it's dual SIM support is non existent. It will receive texts from both SIMs fine, but all replies will be sent from SIM1. Since my SIM1 is my work phone (because it has a giant data plan) this is a bit of a deal breaker for me. For me the big loss here is custom notifications. EvolveSMS gave me the ability to assign custom sounds/icons for texts from certain people. I also had it set up to re-notify every five minutes if there was an unread text, something that saved me a ton of times when I didn't heard my phone ring or feel it vibrate. I've also been using MightyText to send and receive texts on my laptop. Once again everything here defaults to SIM1. Both of these things are really annoying to me, but not really ASUS' fault. Apparently the dual SIM implementation is non-standard (at least prior to 5.1) so apps are not really able to be written in a way that supports all dual SIM phones. I'm hoping the popularity of the ZF2 might make some app makers include this ability in a future update, but I'm not holding my breath. 
Has anyone else found any hiccups in their workflow using two SIMs?

I'm using dual Sim too, but I have the reverse setup, my personal T-Mobile Sim is sim 1 , work at&t is Sim 2.
Their is a setting for which Sim to default for when using Bluetooth so that should work fine. Myself I prefer picking which Sim to use for each message , it's the same number of button presses as a single Sim phone so I don't mind it.
T-Mobile visual voicemail won't work because it only works over a T-Mobile data connection, that's how it authenticates , my AT&t vvm doesn't work in my setup but T-Mobile does.
Overall I'm really liking being able to consolidate to one phone, the only thing I wish it had was the ability to switch the Sim you use for the data plan via a setting , I'm sure it simplifies the hardware the way they did it but some dual Sim phones let you swap sim to use for the data connection in settings

title: ZenFone 2 E still loses power while plugged in and in use?

thread.text:
Hi, I've got a Zenfone 2E and was watching a NBCLA live feed while the phone is plugged into the supplied wall wart. Problem is that the phone started out at about 93% battery power, but by the time I stopped watching the live stream an hour or more later, it was down to only 63% battery power.
Why in the world is this thing consuming more power than the supplied wall wart (adapter) can put out to keep it charged? Is there a more powerful adapter that I can get that will at least keep it at it's current charge when using it plugged into the wall if not actually still charging it up a bit when in use.
Thanks

What amperage is the charger? Some live stream apps are incredibly power intensive, especially on mobile data, there's a lot of components active and a lot of streaming apps aren't that well optimised.
Posted via the Android Central App

Do you face heating issues?
Posted via the Android Central App

Just a thought, when my phone states that the battery will run out in 5hrs (if i continue current usage), so what happens if I change 'my usage' the battery will probably will last longer or shorter, so why state in the first place that it will be 5 hrs? Seems like a bit of useless info... or am I missing something?

It's an estimate based on your current usage so far. It will clearly not be that accurate right when you start using it from a full charge--it becomes more useful once you get down to 50-60% or so. But it does suggest that if you were to use the phone nonstop, you'd get about 5 hours of total screen-on time, which is pretty good.
well said, sir.

Do u face any heating issues

title: Why won't my Zenfone 2 charge on the port?

thread.text: I have tried for hours to charge my phone on the port on computer and it wont charge. what do I need to do

First, try using a different USB lead. 
Tell us whether that fixes it.
Use only OEM chargers to charge you device.

Noticed that asus phones does not run background apps. 
Viber disconnects after a few seconds after closing window
Life 360 does not update when closed
Etc
Can you help me out? Should i be doing something on the settings or what? Thanks guys.
Posted via the Android Central App

Do you have Autostart Manager set to prevent all apps from autostarting? If so, allow the apps to autostart. Did you install any other "RAM booster" or "battery saver" apps? These might be automatically killing apps as well (which is not a good way of doing things).
Also, do you have Developer Options enabled? If so, make sure "Don't Keep Activities" is unchecked.
